result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn A Welch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If restitution is determined to be owed, during period of prison incarceration 25% of the defendant's Prison Inmate Accounts are to be applied to restitution owed
.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to the sentence in La Crosse County case 14CF51
.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or participate in employment group

Make efforts to obtain GED
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is referred to cognitive "Thinking for a Change" program

Submit DNA test

If it is determined that restitution is owed, during period of Extended Supervision restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to eb established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Cash bond on file is applied to Court costs/fees owed - SEE ASSESSMENT REPORT FOR BALANCE STILL OWED

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Concurrent with Ct 1 of this case
.
